title: Splatterscope
content:
The Splatterscope is a main weapon in the Splatoon series.

The Splatterscope is a Splat Charger with a scope attached. Compared to the scopeless version, it has enhanced range and a zoomed view for greater aiming precision, but players have their field of vision limited by the scope, and it can not store its charge in swim form. Besides all of this, all other stats are the same as the Splat Charger, and it shares its sub and special weapons.

The Splatterscope is nearly identical in appearance to the Splat Charger. The only difference between the two is that the Splatterscope has a scope attached to the back end of the barrel.

The Splatterscope comes with Splat Bombs and the Bomb Rush.

- The Splatterscope is a middleweight weapon.

- Ink consumption scales from 2.4% to 18% depending on the charge level.
The full-charge ink consumption of 18% allows players to fire 5 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- The scoped view begins to appear at 50% charge and becomes fully zoomed in at 100% charge.

- The scope limits the y-axis field of view to 28 degrees.

- The Splatterscope cannot store its charge.

- It takes 1 second to fully charge the weapon.
When charging a shot with an empty tank, the charge rate is 33.33%, permitting the player to fully charge a shot in 3 seconds.

- Shots cannot pierce through enemies.

- When charging while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.2 units per frame.

- Shot velocity scales from 12 to 35.29 units per frame depending on the charge level. At full charge, the velocity is 48 units per frame.

- Shot distance scales from 90 to 200 depending on the charge level. At full charge, the distance is 286.

- The full-charge ink consumption of 18% allows players to fire 5 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

The Splatterscope returns for Splatoon 2, with visual changes. It was not given the charge holding feature that the Splat Charger and other chargers were given. It comes with Splat Bombs and Sting Ray.

- Unlike Damage Up in Splatoon, while Main Power Up increases damage, it does not allow shots below full charge to reach 100.0 damage.

It appears in two Octo Expansion stations:

- G05 Bustalicious Station

- H04 Shooter McStation

The Splatterscope is a Splat Charger with an added scope for more effective long-distance aiming. It's great for hitting far-off targets, but your view is narrow while charging, so careful where you use it! Also, that fancy scope there takes up space, so something had to go. In this case, we had to nix the ability to store your charge. But hey, if you like to stay safe and shoot from afar, this could be the charger for you! And the Splat Bombs and Sting Ray make this special scoped model worth a try, eh?

The Splatterscope is a Splat Charger with an added scope for more effective long-distance aiming. It's great for hitting far-off targets, but your view is narrow while charging, so be extra careful! Also, that fancy scope there takes up space, so something had to go. In this case, we had to nix the ability to store your charge. But hey, if you like to stay safe and shoot from afar, this could be the charger for you! When you're not scoping and sniping, you've also got Splat Bombs and the Ink Vac at your disposal, so this is a more balanced set than it would appear. Give it a try!

For competitive tips about the Splatterscope

- The Splatterscope was one of the weapons that was available to use in the Splatoon 3 Splatfest World Premiere.

- As of Fresh Season 2023, the Splatterscope is the only weapon (besides the Splat Charger) to receive only new variants, with its old variants not returning.

- The 2D icon for the Splatterscope displays the scope portion as being yellow, when normally it changes color to match the player's ink.
Unlike other weapons whose 2D icon colors are inconsistent with their in-game appearance, such as Dread Wringer, the coloring of the scope is not present in the 3D version of its icon.
